question_text: Why are cable modems commonly used in both home and enterprise networks?
answer_options: They support satellite uplinks and remote access by default
They offer symmetric data speeds and low latency
They share infrastructure with existing cable TV services
They require no external power or configuration
correct_answer: They share infrastructure with existing cable TV services
explanation: Cable modems use the same coax infrastructure as cable TV, making them accessible and scalable for high-speed data.
